# Out-Of-Hospital Cardiac Arrest {#sec-oohca}


## Epidemiology and Risk Factors

Community cardiac arrest:

* 50-150/100,000 person-years

## Pathophysiology

### Aetiology

Cause is commonly primary cardiac:

* STE\
If STE present, aim cardiac catheterisation.
* No STE\
Strongly consider cardiac catheterisation anyway, as 33% will have a PCI-treatable lesion.

## Key Studies

**Angiography**:

* PCI has clear mortality benefits in STEMI, but not in NSTEMI
* CAD is highly prevalent in patients with OOHCA\
Culprit (>50% stenosis) coronary lesions are found in ~1/3^rd^ of OOHCA without STE.
